product_features: Product Features: ["Balanced Filter Coffee Taste", "Aroma Zones", "Flavours", "Natural paper", "Paper", "Responsible source", "Melitta Coffee experts"]
author: Anupam
content: The product quality is good. The box was delivered crushed, but the filters inside are fine. Amazon says this is a 2-Cup filter paper. However, the size is too big even for my 4 cup coffee maker. The 1X2 coffee filter fits it correctly. I have been buying 102 size for some time. Sometimes Amazon sends 1X2 size for 2-cup coffee filter, and this size is correct. But this time they sent 102 size, and this is too big.

author: Jane
content: I don't like this item not because of the quality but because of the design of this whole filtering method. Although it is for 2 cups, I would still suggest that you pour water into it several times. Why? It's just the speed that water flows through is not even. If you pour 2 cups of water inside all at once, you'll surely get coffee that is too watery, because the water flows through very very quickly. Yet when the water reaches the bottom, it flows too slowly. I have to honestly say that this design is not as smart as the Japanese drip bags made of paper. It costs an extra ceramic cup, is clumsy, but doesn't do the job perfectly.

author: pianopedals
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 13, 2024
content: LORT Count of the number times we had to rinse the filters with boiled water before any papery flavor and taste were gone. Usually with white paper filters it's only a couple of times.Unfortunately,  they've now added these aroma pur holes which let in cafestol & kahweol coffee oils.The whole point of choosing the paper filter method is to filter out this gunk these compounds. They might add extra flavor they might add a fraction of extra fiber for some people, but these harmful coffee oils Skyrocket your blood pressure and upset your insides. Stick with the bleached filters
